intro: Haemadictyon venosum, commonly known as the veined nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes other species known for their stinging hairs. The plant features a distinctive, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense inflorescences, typically greenish-white in color. The leaves and stems contain irritant chemicals, making them potentially harmful to touch.
